name: places/ChIJjQlQe4xZwokRirW3QHPewpo
formattedAddress: 60 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 60 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: Designed with rich fabrics, this hotel bar serves house cocktails & Italian-style bar bites.

originalText.text: This place was BEAUTIFUL!!! The view, the drinks, the vibes = so amazing. I kept this place noted since I can bring my friends here. We had such a good time just chatting and drinking the cocktails. We stayed so late,  cause we felt so comfortable and safe and just were genuinely having the best time. I would 10/10 recommend

text.text: This place was BEAUTIFUL!!! The view, the drinks, the vibes = so amazing. I kept this place noted since I can bring my friends here. We had such a good time just chatting and drinking the cocktails. We stayed so late,  cause we felt so comfortable and safe and just were genuinely having the best time. I would 10/10 recommend

originalText.text: The bar vibe and atmosphere is cute for a date or quick drinks with friends. Had a terrible time recently came for a friend’s bday, I was having back pain due to throwing my back out earlier in the week and asked for a comfy chair vs the allocated stool for the reserved area we were given. Management was very polite and allowed me a different chair with back support. A gentleman sitting beside me felt entitled to the seat and asked the wait staff to switch the seating arrangements. When the wait staff advocated for me he threw a fit and continued to switch the seating arrangements to get his way. His behavior and entitled demeanor was very off putting so my girlfriends and I decided to leave. Appreciate the staff for accommodating me given my condition but really did not like the behavior of that gentlemen. I don’t want to mingle with people this entitled.

originalText.text: Truly wasn’t impressed. The bouncer gave me a hard time about getting in, even after I gave the reservation name and my ID. The atmosphere itself is cool but way too dark. The food was bland and the service wasn’t the best. Took forever to get a drink. Glasses were chipped too.

text.text: Truly wasn’t impressed. The bouncer gave me a hard time about getting in, even after I gave the reservation name and my ID. The atmosphere itself is cool but way too dark. The food was bland and the service wasn’t the best. Took forever to get a drink. Glasses were chipped too.

originalText.text:
Last night my boyfriend and I had the opportunity to go to Butterfly Bar, we arrived around 10:00PM, we ordered two cocktails and sat at the bar. What seemed like a really nice bar turned into a terrible experience due to the homophobic comments made by the bartender Brayan. He was talking to who appeared to be the Bar Manager(Shorter Latino guy with a gray sweater). Brayan told his coworker in a derogatory way in Spanish that my boyfriend and I were “CULEROS.” He not only said this word once but repeated this word again with a little hatred in his voice.

To Brayan's surprise, he didn't know I'm Latino solely based on my appearance. Since he was making drinks in front of us I confronted him about this homophobic word used and he got nervous and apologized to us. He then relocated to the other end of the bar to avoid us. A lot of whispering and eye rolling continued from Brayan and his manager until we left. It is unfortunate that these types of homophobic acts against the LGBTQ+ Community still continue to occur in New York City today.

originalText.text:
I just had a very disappointing experience!
I have been staying at the Sixty Soho hotel for about a week at a family suite avg $1k/night. Every single night we have being spending time at either their rooftop or lobby bar (Butterfly lounge). On my last night, we booked a reservation for the Butterfly lounge through the hotel concierge. I even got an email confirmation for the reservation. Upon arrival, I was greeted by the lounge “manager” who wanted to clarify me that they work separtely from the hotel and that my reservation was for the rooftop and not the lounge. She even told me that, that kind of mistake (hotel concierge mistake) is why she “doesn’t work on the hospitality industry”. How ignorant can you be as a lounge/bar manager to think you are not part of the hospitality industry??  Her attitude and rudeness trying to clarify me about issues that are purely management related between them and the hotel were truly unnecessary as a hotel guest. More so when they had more than enough space to accommodate us. Her hostility truly discouraged us from ever sponsoring this place again. I do not understand how the hotel can allow such treatment of their guest from a tenant.
